keyword: how many calories in a cup of sugar
title: How Many Calories in a Cup of Sugar?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a cup of sugar, including full nutrition breakdown per 100 g basis, totals for 1 cup (200 g), and quick tweaks for variations like brown sugar.
h1: How Many Calories in a Cup of Sugar?
assumptions: Granulated white sugar; 1 cup ≈ 200 g by weight; no additives.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (white, brown, etc.), brand, packing density, and measurement; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One cup of granulated sugar provides about 774 calories, entirely from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Use brown sugar instead (per cup, ≈220 g)
For raw cane sugar (per cup, similar density)

faqs.q: How many calories in a cup of white sugar?
faqs.a: Approximately 774 calories for 1 cup (200 g) of granulated white sugar.
Yes, 100% carbohydrates, with 200 g carbs and 200 g sugars per cup.

faqs.q: How does brown sugar compare in calories to white?
faqs.a: Similar; 1 cup brown sugar has about 824 calories due to slightly higher weight.

faqs.q: Does the type of sugar affect calorie count?
faqs.a: Yes, density varies—powdered sugar has fewer calories per cup (~465) than granulated.

faqs.q: Any protein or fat in sugar?
faqs.a: No protein or fat; it's pure carbs with negligible sodium.
